## **Title2:** Inconsistent Design for "Search Tokens" and "Search Indices" Search Buttons

**Description:**
The designs for the **"Search Tokens"** and **"Search Indices"** search buttons are different These buttons should have a consistent design to ensure a unified user experience and improve the overall UI consistency.

[https://jam.dev/c/30b1de19-d8e1-47ae-ab59-f91886d39bd4](https://jam.dev/c/30b1de19-d8e1-47ae-ab59-f91886d39bd4)

## **Title3:** "Investor Index" and "Price Performance" Sections Should Be Fixed on Scroll

**Description:**
The **"Investor Index"** and **"Price Performance"** sections on the left side of the page should remain **fixed** when scrolling down. Currently, these sections scroll away with the page, which makes it difficult for users to refer to them while exploring other content on the page.

[https://jam.dev/c/e8517a01-b45f-4513-bd9b-9e9f0127648b](https://jam.dev/c/e8517a01-b45f-4513-bd9b-9e9f0127648b)

## Title4: There is no tooltip for Index Selection

[https://jam.dev/c/3938fa3a-ad2b-49e2-82ac-e0f2cabd64ab](https://jam.dev/c/3938fa3a-ad2b-49e2-82ac-e0f2cabd64ab). Could you send the tooltip detail?

## Title5: Sorting Not Available for "Top Gainer" Column in All Indices Table

**Description:**
In the **All Indices** table, the **"Top Gainer"** column does not have sorting functionality, and users cannot sort the data in this column. We need to evaluate whether sorting is necessary for this column or if the current behavior is appropriate. @ayo Do we need to sort Top Gainer?

[https://jam.dev/c/ab2018b5-b5a3-4c4f-91f3-4dadf50389d5](https://jam.dev/c/ab2018b5-b5a3-4c4f-91f3-4dadf50389d5)

## Title6: Token Count Showing 10 for All Indices

**Description:**
The **Token Count** for all indices is displayed as **10**, but it is unclear whether this is the correct number for every index. We need to verify if the **Token Count** should always be 10 for each index, or if this is an issue with how the data is being retrieved or displayed.

[https://jam.dev/c/a2a0f35b-8ea8-40a9-9499-402b0e4fbe54](https://jam.dev/c/a2a0f35b-8ea8-40a9-9499-402b0e4fbe54)

## Title7: Data Units and Clarity Missing in Indices Price History Chart

**Description:**
In the **Indices Price History** chart, the displayed data is unclear, and it is not specified which **unit** the data is in (e.g., price, percentage, or other metrics). Additionally, it's uncertain if the data display format is correct. This makes it difficult for users to interpret the chart accurately. @ayo 

[https://jam.dev/c/7afe878c-622d-44b2-851b-e769835397d5](https://jam.dev/c/7afe878c-622d-44b2-851b-e769835397d5)

## **Title8:** "Buy Token" Button Unclickable Due to Layout Shift

**Description:**
The **"Buy Token"** button is not clickable because its position shifts unexpectedly, preventing users from interacting with it. This issue is likely due to layout changes or misalignment of the button on the page.

[https://jam.dev/c/359601f4-ba55-4284-b989-78cfe21d7d19](https://jam.dev/c/359601f4-ba55-4284-b989-78cfe21d7d19)

## Title9: Default Selection in Index Performance Chart Should Be "Max" Instead of "1Y"

**Description:**
In the **Index Performance Chart**, the default selection is currently set to **1Y**. However, according to the **Figma design**, the default selection should be **Max** instead. This inconsistency affects the user experience, as the chart initially shows the wrong time range.

[https://jam.dev/c/af384c5a-7e5a-4aa6-ad85-82e2ab67c3fc](https://jam.dev/c/af384c5a-7e5a-4aa6-ad85-82e2ab67c3fc)

data.title: [Group] - Sentient Indices Platform Testing 3
data.description:
## Title1: Tooltips Not Opening in Last Index Transactions

**Description:**
In the **Last Index Transactions** section, the tooltips do not open when hovering over the relevant elements. This issue prevents users from viewing additional information that should be displayed in the tooltips.

[https://jam.dev/c/081f311a-f023-43eb-bbb4-a6becd1c2bbb](https://jam.dev/c/081f311a-f023-43eb-bbb4-a6becd1c2bbb)

## Title2: 404 Error When Clicking "Top Trending Indices"

**Description:**
When clicking on the **"Top Trending Indices"** button, a **404 error** is returned, indicating that the requested page or resource is not found. This prevents users from accessing the trending indices data.

[https://jam.dev/c/8f92b439-7ea1-42df-9774-16e9df0348de](https://jam.dev/c/8f92b439-7ea1-42df-9774-16e9df0348de)

## Title3: 0% Displayed for 10 Tokens in Cryptocurrency Section

**Description:**
In the **Cryptocurrency** section, 10 tokens are displayed, but their respective values are shown as **0%**. This issue could cause confusion, as it appears that the tokens have no value or change in percentage, even though they are being displayed.

[https://jam.dev/c/7d13659a-187d-4525-9e5c-55a8cc129727](https://jam.dev/c/7d13659a-187d-4525-9e5c-55a8cc129727)

## **Title4:** Only 2 Index Holdings Visible in Dog-Themed Index Holdings Section

**Description:**
In the **Dog-Themed Index Holdings** section, only **2 index holdings** are visible, even though there should be more listed. This could be due to a data retrieval issue or an incorrect filter being applied, limiting the number of holdings displayed.

[https://jam.dev/c/88beca17-80c4-4b2b-984e-684e67f6ee1e](https://jam.dev/c/88beca17-80c4-4b2b-984e-684e67f6ee1e)

## **Title5:** "Top Trending Indices" Showing Negative Percentage as Green Instead of Red

**Description:**
In the **Top Trending Indices** section, negative percentages are displayed in **green** instead of **red**, which is misleading. Negative values should be displayed in red to indicate a loss or decline, but currently, they are incorrectly shown in green.

[https://jam.dev/c/c56670b1-d3ab-4e8f-bae6-636cb067c121](https://jam.dev/c/c56670b1-d3ab-4e8f-bae6-636cb067c121)

## **Title6:** Market Cap Field Missing for Some Coins in **Index Holdings**

**Description:**
The **Market Cap** data is missing for some coins in the cryptocurrency section. This results in incomplete data for certain coins, which could confuse users or prevent them from making informed decisions.

[https://jam.dev/c/cf9ca2de-bb59-4f00-a248-1ebb6d4e6f74](https://jam.dev/c/cf9ca2de-bb59-4f00-a248-1ebb6d4e6f74)

## **Title7:** Unnecessary Space Above Exchange Pop-in

**Description:**
There is an **unnecessary space** above the **Exchange pop-in** on the page, which affects the layout and user experience. The space does not seem intentional and creates a visually unappealing gap between the content and the pop-in.

[https://jam.dev/c/0105fd79-428f-4f29-a76f-a7e10f4bff06](https://jam.dev/c/0105fd79-428f-4f29-a76f-a7e10f4bff06)

## Title8: Token icon on tree map not properly formatted

#### **Description:**

The token icons on the **tree map** are not properly formatted, leading to visual inconsistencies. This affects the overall readability and usability of the visualization.

[https://jam.dev/c/1c99c2eb-919a-41a4-abf3-a5170ec19ff6](https://jam.dev/c/1c99c2eb-919a-41a4-abf3-a5170ec19ff6)

data.title: Design and Integrate Tab Bar for Indices
data.description:
Design and integrate a tab bar in the indices section to allow users to switch between:

* **Sector Details**
* **Trader Details**
* **Investor Details**
* **Index-Specific Details**

**Requirements:**

* Ensure a smooth UI/UX transition between tabs.
* Maintain consistency with existing design elements.
* Implement using the existing design system (if applicable).
* Ensure responsiveness across different screen sizes.

comments.body:
@ozcan I explained why it is a bit slow in that ticket. When we remove the posthog check, routing to that page would be a bit faster 

Cc: @harshg
Which task is it? @williams this issue reported in [ENG-5040](https://linear.app/token-metrics/issue/ENG-5040/[group]-sentient-indices-platform-testing-8) item2 also. Looks like not fixed yet. fyi.
@ozcan we already have the ticket to integrate parallel routing for the tab so it will be fixed

InformalTest: [https://jam.dev/c/5e9e47e4-24f6-480b-b85f-bb308b0d428c](https://jam.dev/c/5e9e47e4-24f6-480b-b85f-bb308b0d428c) There is a slowness on the first attempt when switching between tabs. @harshg

**Action item taken:**

* Designed the tab for task switching between the Trader, Investor, and Sector tabs.
* Added routing to the appropriate pages.
* Included the "Last Updated" field in the layout.

Jam - [https://jam.dev/c/5b3ab849-1ee3-49f2-a0e4-ca63bb183ca2](https://jam.dev/c/5b3ab849-1ee3-49f2-a0e4-ca63bb183ca2)

**Note:** Currently, clicking on the tab reloads the entire page because we're using the existing tab from the current indices, which is not supported in this design. To maintain consistency, changes are needed in the front-end layout, but that is outside the scope of this ticket since it relates to the parent
This comment thread is synced to a corresponding [GitHub issue](https://github.com/token-metrics/tokenmetrics-3.0/issues/6450). All replies are displayed in both locations.

data.title: Creating Application Set, Project for each environment, / Adding cluster to Argocd
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Urgent Migration of Kubernetes Workloads to Digital Ocean with ArgoCD Integration

**Description:** Address technical debt by migrating our Kubernetes workloads to Digital Ocean. This involves creating Application Sets and Projects for each environment and adding the new cluster to ArgoCD to ensure streamlined deployment and management.

**Business Rationale:** Transitioning to Digital Ocean will enhance our infrastructure scalability, reduce operational costs, and improve deployment efficiency. Promptly addressing this migration is essential to maintain system reliability and support our growth objectives.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Application Sets are created for all environments (development, staging, production) in ArgoCD.
* Projects are defined and configured in ArgoCD for each respective environment.
* The Digital Ocean Kubernetes cluster is successfully added and integrated with ArgoCD.
* All Kubernetes workloads are migrated to the Digital Ocean cluster and deployed without issues.
* Deployment functionality is verified and operates correctly across all environments.

data.title: Grafana cloud bill sky rocket root cause - (DevOps Meeting)
data.description:
**Description:**

During our recent DevOps meeting, we identified that the root cause of the skyrocketing Grafana Cloud bill is due to the usage of Grafana Cloud endpoints as our primary data sources. This configuration has resulted in a significant increase in data volume, leading directly to elevated billing costs.

**Impact:**

• Increased operational costs due to higher data volume consumption

• Potential risk of exceeding budget allocations if not addressed promptly

**Root Cause:**

• Use of Grafana Cloud endpoints as data sources is causing a high volume of data to be ingested, which in turn drives up the billing.

**Proposed Next Steps:**

1\. Evaluate alternative data sourcing options to reduce data volume consumption. (our self hosted options)

2\. Meet with grafana rep to Look at ways to save cost

3\. Monitor billing closely after implementing changes to ensure cost reduction.

comments.body: Hi @ian, I and @divine will have a report by monday

@peterson how did the call go?

Do we need both Grafana and Signoz? I believe @suleman was saying we can just use Signoz for monitoring everything since there's overlap.

Hey @ian we have a meeting with grafana engineer today to discuss on this; based on the outcome I and @divine would profer a solution of whether to continue or self host. But duly note that we can self host grafana and have the features we need
@peterson can we do all of this on our own self hosted Grafana?

data.title: Fix the RPC url issue on Solana chain of LIFI for on-chain swap.
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Resolve RPC URL Issue on Solana Chain for LIFI On-Chain Swaps

**Description:**
Address the current malfunctioning RPC URLs affecting the Solana network integration within the LIFI platform’s on-chain swap feature. Ensure reliable connectivity and transaction processing by updating or replacing the faulty RPC endpoints.

**Business Rationale:**
A stable and reliable RPC connection is essential for facilitating seamless on-chain swaps on the Solana network. Resolving this issue will enhance user experience, increase transaction reliability, and maintain the integrity of the LIFI platform’s services, thereby supporting user trust and platform growth.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Identify and rectify the faulty RPC URLs for the Solana chain used in LIFI’s on-chain swap module.
2. Implement updated or alternative RPC endpoints to ensure consistent connectivity.
3. Successfully execute on-chain swap transactions on Solana using the new RPC URLs without errors.
4. Conduct thorough testing to validate performance and reliability under various network conditions.
5. Update relevant documentation and configuration settings to reflect the changes made.

comments.body: I used the rpc url of quicknode which LIFI demo widget is using for the Solana chain.
This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.
This comment thread is synced to a corresponding [GitHub issue](https://github.com/token-metrics/tokenmetrics-3.0/issues/6414). All replies are displayed in both locations.

data.title: Fix Token Details Page UI for Small Screens & Implement Mobile Responsiveness Design
data.description:
[Jam | Console logs, network requests, and more](https://jam.dev/c/f555d124-59f9-4272-85fd-189fa3443a8d)

[mobile responsive - TMAI_task (Figma)](https://www.figma.com/design/74Zz1grTtdFlkydLSZe3q7/TMAI_task?node-id=3515-45385&t=2hKL9NIohoR7PvLM-4)

**Description:**
The **Token Details** page currently displays correctly only on large desktop screens. However, on small desktop and mobile screens, the UI breaks:

* Elements are misplaced.
* The layout does not properly adapt to smaller screens.
* In some cases, mobile responsiveness is not automatically triggered for certain mobile screen sizes.

**Issues Identified:**

* **Exchange Popup & Chart** do not scale properly.
* Some sections (e.g., **"Exchanges"** and **"Trading Signals PnL"**) cause layout issues.
* Users need to zoom out manually on mobile to view content properly.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Ensure the **Token Details** page layout adapts properly to **small desktop and mobile screens**.
2. Fix misplaced elements to align correctly on all screen sizes.
3. Ensure **mobile responsiveness is automatically triggered** across all standard mobile resolutions.
4. Improve scaling of popups, tables, and charts for better usability.

data.title: UNGUESS Bugs - On-chain swaps
data.description:
## 1\. Token Displays on Incorrect Blockchain in Exchange Widget

 **Device:** Apple iPhone 12 Pro Max
**OS:** iOS 18.1
**Feature:** Exchange Widget

#### **Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Click on a *Best Daily Performer* token.
2. View the *Exchange Widget*.

#### **Expected Result:**

* The selected token should appear on the blockchain where the wallet is connected.
* If the token is not available on the connected blockchain, an error should be displayed:
  *“Token not found on \[blockchain name\]. Try again with another network.”*

#### **Actual Result:**

* The selected token appears on a different blockchain than the one the wallet is connected to.

#### **Impact:**

* Misleading token information could lead to confusion and failed transactions.

#### **Priority:** High

[29ee9f52e36d61235380fb6e195e22724c6a65f5e0ee2849431c5ab59d62c157.MP4](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/4253f5e1-cdae-45b2-8894-8138d71a76a3/9ee1c78f-ee72-49de-a534-66205bfd4925)

![e1876dd796ec0433bfe1804d1428380504c1a6299cb00fde4a2f6cf7f99aeb37.PNG](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/b8108969-9d0c-4ada-8780-386ff09aabb2/74fbc405-f3d7-4e01-ba3b-c01decbe504b)

## 2\. Unsupported Token Can Still Be Swapped

**Feature:** Ratings Page
**Device:** Ultrabook
**OS:** Windows 11 (22471)
**Priority:** Medium
**Status:** To Do

#### **Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Open the website.
2. Connect MetaMask to the site.
3. Click the **BUY** button on a token that is not supported for swaps (e.g., "SONIC").
4. Follow the exchange flow.

#### **Expected Result:**

* It should not be possible to swap a token if it is not supported.
* The swap function should be disabled or an error message should be displayed.

#### **Actual Result:**

* Despite the site indicating that the swap is not supported, the token can still be swapped.

[529c479cd5ca13da887d35e531fec4a7661b25c5c8ccf96014361ac7fd8cf6f1.mp4](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/c96ddd7d-d761-4133-bf5c-9077699d6554/eae0d7aa-d18d-4486-b195-f7c80fd4a394)

issues.full_context:
Title: UNGUESS Bugs - On-chain swaps

Description:
## 1\. Token Displays on Incorrect Blockchain in Exchange Widget

 **Device:** Apple iPhone 12 Pro Max
**OS:** iOS 18.1
**Feature:** Exchange Widget

#### **Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Click on a *Best Daily Performer* token.
2. View the *Exchange Widget*.

#### **Expected Result:**

* The selected token should appear on the blockchain where the wallet is connected.
* If the token is not available on the connected blockchain, an error should be displayed:
  *“Token not found on \[blockchain name\]. Try again with another network.”*

#### **Actual Result:**

* The selected token appears on a different blockchain than the one the wallet is connected to.

#### **Impact:**

* Misleading token information could lead to confusion and failed transactions.

#### **Priority:** High

[29ee9f52e36d61235380fb6e195e22724c6a65f5e0ee2849431c5ab59d62c157.MP4](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/4253f5e1-cdae-45b2-8894-8138d71a76a3/9ee1c78f-ee72-49de-a534-66205bfd4925)

![e1876dd796ec0433bfe1804d1428380504c1a6299cb00fde4a2f6cf7f99aeb37.PNG](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/b8108969-9d0c-4ada-8780-386ff09aabb2/74fbc405-f3d7-4e01-ba3b-c01decbe504b)

## 2\. Unsupported Token Can Still Be Swapped

**Feature:** Ratings Page
**Device:** Ultrabook
**OS:** Windows 11 (22471)
**Priority:** Medium
**Status:** To Do

#### **Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Open the website.
2. Connect MetaMask to the site.
3. Click the **BUY** button on a token that is not supported for swaps (e.g., "SONIC").
4. Follow the exchange flow.

#### **Expected Result:**

* It should not be possible to swap a token if it is not supported.
* The swap function should be disabled or an error message should be displayed.

#### **Actual Result:**

* Despite the site indicating that the swap is not supported, the token can still be swapped.

[529c479cd5ca13da887d35e531fec4a7661b25c5c8ccf96014361ac7fd8cf6f1.mp4](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/c96ddd7d-d761-4133-bf5c-9077699d6554/eae0d7aa-d18d-4486-b195-f7c80fd4a394)

![46a81257504e564d1f0920617dfe3ceda01508d264fb2dde83c8e32ab1c58e17.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/e17ff169-4ce0-439f-9577-74d8916a4c6c/d9774529-0cbd-4dac-b69a-3be9a6cbbd8b)

**Title:** Resolve Merge Conflicts and Fix NFT Burn to Stake Navigation

**Business Rationale:**
Maintaining a clean and conflict-free codebase is essential for the stability and reliability of our application. Fixing the auto-redirect and navigation issues enhances user experience, ensuring that users can seamlessly access the NFT Burn to Stake feature, which is crucial for user engagement and satisfaction.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. All merge conflicts are resolved successfully using the latest pull.
2. The auto-redirect functionality operates without errors.
3. Navigating to the NFT Burn to Stake feature directs users to "/astrobot-burn-to-stake" or the designated URL.
4. Verified through testing that the navigation and auto-redirect work as intended across all supported browsers and devices.

data.title: [Trading Agent] Correct the PNL data
data.description:
![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/8f16fbc7-e4fa-46ba-8148-e7878249b7cd/013aec8a-e164-4f39-a308-a761a0f64527)

The ROI is negative where the PNL should be negative as well. But why there is no data?

I guess it used round to 0 decimals. Please:

1. Drop the decimals, and I will round in the backend.
2. Check whey it shows 0 for the PNL as it shows normally in the database:

```
SELECT TOKEN_ID, PNL, ROI FROM  TRADING_BOT_DEX.APP.MY_BOTS_VIEW WHERE USER_ID = 144378;
```

| TOKEN_ID | PNL | ROI |
| -- | -- | -- |
| 3306 | 0 | 0 |
| 40825 | \-0.2 | \-20.26 |
| 4481 | 0 | 0 |
| 33058 | \-0.27 | \-26.94 |
| 3988 | 0 | 0 |
| 4056 | 0 | 0 |
| 3306 | 0 | 0 |
| 14122 | 0 | 0 |
| 36697 | \-0.26 | \-25.78 |
| 16535 | 0 | 0 |

Note: I already use the round, please do not use any rounds.

---

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** \[Trading Agent\] Correct PNL Data to Reflect Accurate ROI

**Description:**
The current Profit and Loss (PNL) data for the Trading AI Agents is showing a negative Return on Investment (ROI), which indicates potential inaccuracies in data calculation or reporting. This issue undermines the reliability of performance metrics used by stakeholders to evaluate trading strategies.

**Business Rationale:**
Accurate PNL data is essential for assessing the effectiveness of trading agents and making informed financial decisions. Incorrect ROI figures can lead to mistrust in the platform, misguided investment strategies, and potential financial losses for users.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. PNL calculations accurately reflect all trading activities, including gains and losses.
2. ROI is correctly computed based on the updated PNL data.
3. Data sources integrated via Privy and LiFi gateways are validated for accuracy and consistency.
4. Frontend displays the corrected PNL and ROI without errors.
5. All related functionalities pass quality assurance testing and are verified against expected outcomes.

data.title: [Trading Agent] Missed Date&Time
data.description:
![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/d1b1535c-3471-4331-b962-8f3706325c32/b94dcffd-a27d-49a3-a78d-7e5917237180)

* The `Date & Time` should be found over `Time`:

```
SELECT TIME, TOKEN_ID, PNL FROM TRADING_BOT_DEX.APP.TRADING_HISTORY_VIEW WHERE USER_ID = 144378;
```

* Added the `Date & Time` data

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** \[Trading Agent\] Missing Date & Time Display

**Description:**
The Trading AI Agent frontend is not displaying the Date and Time for trading activities. This omission hinders users from accurately tracking and reviewing their trading history.

**Business Rationale:**
Displaying Date and Time information is crucial for users to monitor their trading activities effectively. It enhances transparency, supports informed decision-making, and improves overall user satisfaction with the platform.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Date and Time are visible for each trading activity entry in the frontend.
* The display format adheres to the platform’s design standards.
* Date and Time information updates in real-time with each new trade.
* The feature is tested and functions correctly across all supported browsers and devices.

data.title: [Trading Agent] Trading Signal correction
data.description:
![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/f3334dc3-361d-4919-8cf9-034c71c617df/d93490d6-8bab-478f-9f1f-483154cde5dc)

# Need to be Changed:

1. Replace the data source of the `TRADING_SIGNAL` to `TRADING_SIGNAL_TEXT`

```
SELECT TOKEN_ID, TRADING_SIGNAL_TEXT FROM TRADING_BOT_DEX.APP.ALL_TRADING_BOTS_VIEW WHERE TOKEN_ID = 3306;
```

Now it will have `Bearish`, `Bullish`, `Holding`

2. Please show the `Bearish` in red color and `Bullish` in green color and `Holding` in white color

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** \[Trading Agent\] Correct Trading Signal Processing

**Description:**
Fix the inaccuracies in the trading signal generation of V1 Trading AI Agents by integrating Privy and LiFi gateways. This correction will transition the existing CEX Trading Bot to a reliable DEX Trading Agent, ensuring accurate signal interpretation and execution on decentralized exchanges.

**Business Rationale:**
Enhancing the accuracy of trading signals is essential for the performance and reliability of our Trading AI Agents. By converting the CEX Trading Bot to a DEX Trading Agent through Privy and LiFi integration, we can offer decentralized trading solutions, attract a wider user base, and stay competitive in the evolving crypto trading landscape.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Trading signals are accurately generated and reflect real-time market data on DEX platforms.
2. Successful integration of Privy and LiFi gateways without introducing frontend bugs.
3. The Trading AI Agent operates seamlessly on DEXs, matching the performance previously achieved on CEXs.
4. Comprehensive testing confirms the reliability and accuracy of trading signals post-integration.
5. Updated documentation detailing the integration process and any changes to signal processing.

data.title: [Trading Agent] Missed Trader Grade
data.description:
![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/a2ac5b3e-d04b-4029-9165-2276561efbd6/e4dab9e3-0241-435c-985e-3abdd29c5ad0)

There is no Trader Grade:

```
SELECT TOKEN_ID, TOKEN_SYMBOL, TRADER_GRADE FROM TRADING_BOT_DEX.APP.ALL_TRADING_BOTS_VIEW WHERE TOKEN_ID = 3306 AND CHAINID = 1;
```

| TOKEN_ID | TOKEN_SYMBOL | TRADER_GRADE |
| -- | -- | -- |
| 3306 | ETH | 19.15 |

# Requirements:

1. Fixed the data issue in the table

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** \[Trading Agent\] Missing Trader Grade for Chao Li

**Description:**
The Trader Grade for Chao Li is not displayed within the V1 Trading AI Agents interface. This issue occurs during the frontend integration of Privy and LiFi, which aims to convert the existing CEX Trading Bot into a DEX Trading Agent.

**Business Rationale:**
Displaying accurate Trader Grades is crucial for maintaining user trust and ensuring transparency in trading activities. Addressing this issue will enhance the user experience, support the credibility of the trading platform, and facilitate a smooth transition from centralized to decentralized trading agents.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. The Trader Grade for Chao Li is correctly displayed in the frontend interface.
2. Integration with Privy and LiFi successfully retrieves and shows Trader Grades for all relevant AI Trading Agents.
3. The Trader Grade display functions consistently across major browsers and devices.

data.title: [Trading Agent] Change the round of the current balance to 2 decimals
data.description:
# Description

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/4ba12741-3268-4c7b-b7f4-485d8862248c/9cd1b169-7d0d-4b66-89f2-58f7cdfd92cc)

The current balance looks so solid, I guess It was round wrongly to the interger.

For example, in the database, I had:

```
SELECT * FROM TRADING_BOT_DEX.APP.CURRENT_BALANCE_CHART_VIEW WHERE USER_ID = 144378 ORDER BY TIME DESC;
```

It should look like this:

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/5e0b6e94-f8b3-4759-98eb-37f48aa00e1f/c91ede21-0ece-4032-81e0-8a08e3b04cd7)

Requirements:

1. Drop the round, making the graph looking smoothly and I will round them to 2 decimals in the database.
2. Keep `$8.36` as the number should be 2 decimals.

Groomed Issue:

**Issue Title:** \[Trading Agent\] Display Current Balance with Two Decimal Places

**Description:**  
Update the frontend of the Trading Agent to display the current balance rounded to two decimal places.

**Business Rationale:**  
Providing balance information with two decimal precision enhances user clarity and aligns with standard financial representations, improving user trust and experience.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* The current balance is displayed with exactly two decimal places across all relevant frontend components.
* Balances are correctly rounded following standard financial rounding rules.
* The change does not disrupt the layout or functionality of the UI.
* All related unit and UI tests are updated and pass successfully.

data.title: Investigating Argocd Sync Bug
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Investigate Argocd Sync Bug and Deprecate Applications on Old Cluster

**Description:**  
Address the synchronization issue in Argocd to ensure reliable deployment processes. Additionally, monitor the performance of applications that have been migrated to the new cluster and systematically deprecate those still running on the old cluster.

**Business Rationale:**  
Resolving the Argocd sync bug will improve deployment stability and efficiency, reducing downtime and operational risks. Deprecating applications on the old cluster will lower maintenance costs, streamline infrastructure, and ensure resources are optimally utilized in the new environment.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. The Argocd synchronization bug is identified and successfully resolved, verified by consistent and error-free deployments.
2. All migrated applications on the new cluster are monitored and confirmed to be stable and performing as expected.
3. A deprecation plan for applications on the old cluster is created and executed, ensuring complete transition or safe shutdown.
4. Documentation is updated to reflect the resolution of the sync bug and the deprecation status of old cluster applications.

parent.title: Monitor and deprecate the migrated applications from the old cluster

comments.body:
Steps Taken to Resolve ArgoCD Sync Issue

1 Checked ArgoCD Pods to Identify Issues

Found argocd-repo-server in Error state.

Observed high restarts on argocd-redis-ha-server-1 and argocd-server-6574f4f98b-n78lh.

2 Checked Logs for Troubleshooting

Described the Pod to Get More Details

Issue Identified:

Reason: Evicted

Message: The node was low on resource: memory

3 Checked Node Resource Usage

the eviction happened earlier due to temporary high memory usage, but the node has sufficient memory now to run new pods.

4 Deleted the Evicted Pod to Trigger Recreation

5 Verified ArgoCD Pods Were Running Again

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/a457a23c-0b97-45a0-91f1-e208fd57af4b/906637f8-333f-4b68-819a-a56fe9b17ae3)

### **Synced Applications in ArgoCD** 

![Capture4.PNG](https://uploads.linear.app/3973b0e9-3f84-4e56-bc80-5f55fe46609b/dcec2812-f05d-4cb6-a5ba-860095687b6e/46810ce7-a554-4c37-9ad1-ee81eded1395)
This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Implement Header and Footer Banners on Launchpad Homepage

**Description:**
Add new header and footer banners to the Launchpad Homepage to highlight V1 Private Sales and improve access to Launchpad features.

**Business Rationale:**
Enhancing the homepage with prominent banners will increase visibility of private sales offerings and facilitate easier navigation to Launchpad services, thereby boosting user engagement and driving sales growth.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. **Header Banner:**
   * Displays "V1 Private Sales" prominently.
   * Follows the current branding guidelines.
   * Responsive design for all device sizes.
2. **Footer Banner:**
   * Includes direct links to Launchpad Access.
   * Maintains consistency with the overall site design.
   * Ensures functionality across major browsers.
3. **General:**
   * Banners are reviewed and approved by the design and product teams.
   * Implemented banners pass usability testing without issues.
   * Changes are deployed without negatively impacting existing site performance.

data.title: Update market page UI
data.description:
The issue I found is that it's not very intuitive that users can scroll to the right. Although there is an arrow indicating this, it is barely visible, which could result in users not realizing there are more options beyond the first three displayed.

1. **Rearrange Card Order:**
   * Move the following **proprietary data-driven cards** to the top of the Market Page:
     * **Recently Turned Bullish**
     * **Recently Turned Bearish**
     * **Best Performing Bull Signals**
   * Ensure that these insights are **immediately visible** upon page load.

Making the arrow a lighter color that contrasts better with the background

 Adding a subtle gradient that darkens the right-side container, giving a visual hint that horizontal

scrolling is possible Partially revealing the next slide, allowing it to peek through slightly to create a sense of

continuity

We can also add a title to help users understand what the upcoming highlights are about.

[https://www.figma.com/design/74Zz1grTtdFlkydLSZe3q7/TMAI_task?node-id=9952-11007&t=nW9lRKUueBjrhLQZ-4](https://www.figma.com/design/74Zz1grTtdFlkydLSZe3q7/TMAI_task?node-id=9952-11007&t=nW9lRKUueBjrhLQZ-4)

data.title: meme coin application
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Monitor and Deprecate Migrated Applications from Old Cluster for Meme Coin Application

**Description:**
Ensure all Meme Coin application components have been successfully migrated to the new cluster. Continuously monitor the performance and stability of these applications on the new infrastructure. Once confirmed, proceed to deprecate and shut down the old cluster to eliminate redundancies and optimize resource usage.

**Business Rationale:**
Deprecating the old cluster will streamline infrastructure management, reduce operational costs, and enhance the overall performance and reliability of the Meme Coin application. Monitoring ensures a seamless transition without impacting user experience.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. All Meme Coin applications are fully operational on the new cluster.
2. Performance metrics on the new cluster meet or exceed predefined standards.
3. A monitoring system is established and actively tracking application performance.
4. The old cluster is successfully decommissioned without service interruptions.
5. Relevant documentation is updated to reflect the migration and deprecation process.

data.title: astradao frontend application
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Monitor and Deprecate Applications Migrated from the Old Cluster

**Description:**
Implement a monitoring system to track the usage and performance of applications that have been migrated to the new cluster. Systematically deprecate and retire the corresponding applications running on the old cluster once they are no longer needed.

**Business Rationale:**
Deprecating applications on the old cluster will reduce maintenance costs, eliminate redundant resources, and streamline infrastructure management. This ensures that the frontend application operates on the most efficient and secure environment, enhancing overall performance and reliability.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Monitoring tools are set up to track usage metrics of migrated applications on the old cluster.
2. A report is generated identifying applications with low or no usage over the past three months.
3. Stakeholders are notified of the deprecation schedule with at least two weeks' notice.
4. Identified applications are successfully decommissioned from the old cluster.
5. Confirmation that all necessary functionalities are fully supported on the new cluster post-deprecation.

issues.full_context:
Title: astradao backend applications

Description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Monitor and Deprecate Migrated Astradao Backend Applications from Old Cluster

**Description:**
Implement monitoring for the migrated Astradao backend applications currently running on the old cluster and initiate deprecation procedures to phase them out.

**Business Rationale:**
Transitioning all backend applications to the new cluster will optimize performance, reduce maintenance overhead, and minimize security risks associated with the outdated infrastructure.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Monitoring tools are configured and actively tracking all migrated backend applications on the old cluster.
2. Performance metrics and logs are reviewed regularly for a minimum of 30 days to ensure stability.
3. All dependencies on the old cluster are identified and confirmed to be migrated.
4. Deprecated applications are successfully decommissioned without disrupting active services.
5. Stakeholders are informed of the deprecation status and completion.

data.title: Fix AI code reviewer issues
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Fix AI Code Reviewer Issues

**Description:**

**Description:**  
Address and resolve the current issues affecting the AI code reviewer to enhance its accuracy, reliability, and user experience.

**Business Rationale:**  
Improving the AI code reviewer is essential to ensure high code quality, reduce the time developers spend on manual reviews, and increase overall productivity. Reliable automated reviews also contribute to faster deployment cycles and reduced costs associated with code defects.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. **Bug Resolution:** All reported issues with the AI code reviewer are fixed and verified.
2. **Accuracy:** The AI provides feedback that aligns with standard coding practices and human reviewer assessments.
3. **Performance:** The response time of the AI reviewer meets the predefined performance benchmarks.
4. **Usability:** User feedback indicates improved ease of use and satisfaction with the AI reviewer.
5. **Testing:** Comprehensive tests are conducted to ensure the stability and reliability of the AI code reviewer after fixes.
6. **Documentation:** Relevant documentation is updated to reflect the changes and improvements made.

data.title: Enforce Node pool scaling on the AI clusters
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Enforce Node Pool Scaling on AI Clusters

**Description:**  
Implement enforced scaling policies for node pools within AI clusters to ensure efficient resource management and maintain optimal performance levels.

**Business Rationale:**  
Effective scaling of node pools is essential for balancing resource utilization and controlling costs while ensuring that AI workloads have the necessary computational power. By enforcing scaling policies, we can prevent resource bottlenecks and minimize expenses related to idle or underutilized resources.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Scaling policies are defined and applied to all AI cluster node pools.
* Node pools automatically scale up/down based on predefined CPU and memory usage thresholds.
* Scaling actions are monitored and logged for audit and analysis purposes.
* Performance metrics demonstrate improved resource utilization post-implementation.
* Documentation is updated to reflect the new scaling policies and procedures.

comments.body: Cancelling because we are shifting focus to migrate to digital ocean
This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.

data.title: Monitor and deprecate the migrated applications from the old cluster
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Monitor and Deprecate Migrated Applications from Old Cluster

**Description:**  
Continuously monitor the performance and usage of applications that have been migrated to the new cluster. Identify any dependencies or issues related to the old cluster and systematically deprecate the migrated applications from the old environment to ensure a smooth transition and reduce maintenance overhead.

**Business Rationale:**  
Deprecating applications from the old cluster minimizes resource consumption, reduces potential security vulnerabilities, and ensures that all stakeholders are utilizing the most up-to-date and efficient infrastructure. This process supports operational efficiency and cost-effectiveness by eliminating redundant systems.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* All migrated applications are actively monitored for performance and usage metrics on the new cluster.
* Dependencies on the old cluster are identified and documented for each migrated application.
* A deprecation plan is developed and approved, outlining the steps and timeline for removing applications from the old cluster.
* Migrated applications are successfully removed from the old cluster without impacting their functionality on the new cluster.
* Confirmation that no residual dependencies or issues remain on the old cluster post-deprecation.
* Stakeholders are notified of the deprecation and any necessary updates to documentation or processes are completed.

comments.body: This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.

data.title: Sync with Grafana rep on cost saving possibilities
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Explore Cost-Saving Opportunities with Grafana Representative

**Description:**
Coordinate a meeting with the Grafana representative to discuss and identify potential cost-saving strategies related to our current Grafana usage and subscription plans. Assess available options such as package adjustments, discounts, and optimization techniques to reduce expenses while maintaining necessary functionalities.

**Business Rationale:**
Optimizing our Grafana expenditures will contribute to reducing overall operational costs, allowing for better allocation of resources without compromising on essential monitoring and analytics capabilities.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* A meeting is successfully scheduled and conducted with the Grafana representative.
* Detailed documentation of identified cost-saving opportunities is completed.
* A recommended action plan outlining the implementation of selected cost-saving measures is created.
* Relevant stakeholders review and approve the proposed cost-saving strategies.

comments.body:
[Jam | Console logs, network requests, and more](https://jam.dev/c/9f0a7141-585c-49a6-a8b0-28d5d9ae15f7)

Grafana Implementation Details

Hi Ian,

Please review the Jam video that provides an overview of our Grafana implementation from the call with the representative. The video covers metrics usage, the cause of the spike, when the spike happened and what we have done to ensure it doesnt happen again.

In the meantime, I've set up Grafana locally in our cluster. You can access it at:

* [http://34.121.160.20/](http://34.121.160.20/)
* **i have** setup our Kubernetes dashboards

I'm currently working on migrating our existing cloud dashboards to this local instance.

## Options We're Considering

1. **Grafana Cloud**:
   * Current cost concerns discussed in the video
   * Implemented mitigation steps to optimize spending
   * We currently use Grafana Cloud K6 for load testing, which is an important component of our testing strategy
2. **Locally Hosted**:
   * Recently deployed at 34.121.160.20
   * Potential for cost savings compared to cloud option
   * Would require additional infrastructure management

Let me know your thoughts on which direction we should take. The key consideration is balancing the functionality we need (especially K6 for load testing) against our budget constraints.
This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.

data.title: Trader/Investor - Integrate Last Index Transactions Section
data.description:
* Fetch and display recent index transactions.
* Support **tree map view**, **table view**, and **pagination**.

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Trader/Investor - Integrate Last Index Transactions Section

**Description:**
Implement a section that fetches and displays the most recent index transactions for traders and investors. This section should provide users with up-to-date information on index activities, enhancing their ability to make informed investment decisions.

**Business Rationale:**
Displaying the latest index transactions enables traders and investors to monitor market trends and react promptly to changes. This feature can increase user engagement and satisfaction by providing valuable, real-time financial data, thereby supporting the platform’s objective to offer comprehensive investment tools.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* The section successfully retrieves and displays recent index transactions from the backend.
* Users can switch between tree map view and table view seamlessly.
* Pagination is implemented to navigate through the transactions efficiently.
* The section is responsive and functions correctly across supported devices and browsers.
* Error handling is in place for data fetch failures, with appropriate user feedback.

comments.body:
**Action item taken:**

* Created dynamic hooks to populate data for the Index and Trader views of the Last Index Transaction section.
* Made the hooks dynamic so they can handle three different sections: Index Transaction section for Trader, Investor, or any other Index-specific pages.
* Connected the data to the front-end layout to ensure consistent population.
* Integrated pagination for both the table view and transaction table.
* Handled data population for the Tree Map view.

Jam - [https://jam.dev/c/62b83755-adf9-46ef-a077-2a0dd5f6c73d](https://jam.dev/c/62b83755-adf9-46ef-a077-2a0dd5f6c73d)
This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.
This comment thread is synced to a corresponding [GitHub issue](https://github.com/token-metrics/tokenmetrics-3.0/issues/6331). All replies are displayed in both locations.

data.title: Trader/Investor - Develop Index Performance Chart
data.description:
* Fetch and visualize index performance data using charts.
* Ensure responsiveness and accurate data mapping.

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Develop Index Performance Chart for Trader/Investor

**Description:**
Create a responsive chart that fetches and visualizes index performance data, providing traders and investors with clear and accurate insights into market trends.

**Business Rationale:**
Visualizing index performance enables users to make informed investment decisions by easily understanding market movements and trends, thereby enhancing the platform’s value and user engagement.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. The chart successfully retrieves real-time index performance data from the data source.
2. Data is accurately mapped and displayed using appropriate charting tools.
3. The chart is fully responsive and functions correctly on all major devices and screen sizes.
4. Users can interact with the chart (e.g., hover for details, zoom in/out).
5. Performance metrics load within acceptable time frames without errors.
6. The feature integrates seamlessly with the existing frontend framework.

comments.body:
**Action item taken:**

* Connected the hook to populate data for the performance chart.
* Made the hook dynamic to handle both Trader and Investor views.
* Added server-side data to populate different chart scenarios, including price performance, market cap, FDV, and date filtering.

data.title: Trader/Investor - Integrate Index Details APIs with Frontend
data.description:
* Connect index details APIs to the frontend for both Trader and Investor sections.
* Ensure proper data handling and display variations.
* Handle error states and loading indicators.

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Integrate Index Details APIs with Trader and Investor Frontend

**Description:**
Connect the Index Details APIs to the frontend for both the Trader and Investor sections. Ensure that data is accurately fetched, appropriately handled, and displayed according to each section's specific requirements. Implement error handling and loading indicators to enhance user experience during data retrieval processes.

**Business Rationale:**
Integrating the Index Details APIs will provide traders and investors with real-time and comprehensive index information directly within the platform. This seamless access enhances decision-making capabilities, improves user engagement, and positions the platform as a reliable source for financial data.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. **API Integration:**
   * Successfully connect and retrieve data from the Index Details APIs for both Trader and Investor sections.
2. **Data Handling & Display:**
   * Accurately display index details tailored to the Trader section's needs.
   * Accurately display index details tailored to the Investor section's needs.

data.title: Trader/Investor- Backend Router for Last Index Transactions Section
data.description:
**Task:**
Develop a backend router to handle the **Last Index Transactions** for the Trader and Investor sections. The router should include:

1. **Tree Map View API** – Fetch and return last index transaction data in a format suitable for a tree map visualization.
2. **Table View API** – Provide last index transactions in a structured table format with **pagination support**.
3. **Index Transaction API** – Fetch detailed last index transaction data with filters and sorting options.

Additional considerations:

* Ensure authentication and authorization.
* Optimize API responses for performance and frontend compatibility.
* Implement structured error handling and logging.

* Tested the endpoint.

data.title: Mobile: Implement dark mode for profile screens
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Implement Dark Mode for Profile Screens

**Description:**
Develop and integrate a dark mode feature specifically for the profile screens within the mobile application. This enhancement aims to provide users with a visually comfortable alternative during low-light environments and to adhere to contemporary design preferences.

**Business Rationale:**
Introducing dark mode can significantly improve user experience by reducing eye strain and battery consumption on supported devices. It also meets user demand for customizable interfaces, potentially increasing user engagement and satisfaction. Aligning with current design trends helps maintain the app’s competitiveness in the market.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. **Toggle Functionality:** Users can enable or disable dark mode via the app settings.
2. **Consistent Design:** All elements on the profile screens (text, backgrounds, icons, buttons) appropriately adapt to dark mode without visual glitches.
3. **Persistence:** The selected mode (dark or light) remains consistent across app restarts and sessions.
4. **Accessibility Compliance:** Dark mode adheres to accessibility standards, ensuring sufficient contrast and readability.
5. **No Impact on Light Mode:** Existing light mode features remain unaffected and fully functional after dark mode implementation.
6. **Performance:** Transitioning between modes does not introduce noticeable lag or performance issues.

parent.title: Mobile(Parent): Setup and Implement dark mode

data.title: Mobile: Implement dark mode for settings screen
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Implement Dark Mode for Mobile Settings Screen**

Enable dark mode on the mobile settings screen to enhance user experience and accessibility, particularly in low-light environments. This feature should include a toggle within the settings that allows users to switch between light and dark themes. The dark mode must apply consistently to all elements of the settings screen, retain the user's preference across app sessions, and adhere to accessibility standards for color contrast.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. A toggle is available in the settings screen to switch between light and dark modes.
2. Dark mode styling is consistently applied to all settings screen components.
3. The selected theme preference persists after the app is closed and reopened.
4. Color contrasts in dark mode meet established accessibility guidelines.

data.title: Mobile: Implement dark mode for Intro, login, signup, complete profile screens
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Issue Title:** Implement Dark Mode for Intro, Login, Signup, and Complete Profile Screens

**Description:**  
Enable dark mode across the Intro, Login, Signup, and Complete Profile screens in the mobile application. This includes updating the UI elements, color schemes, and ensuring consistency across all specified screens when dark mode is activated.

**Business Rationale:**  
Introducing dark mode enhances user experience by providing an alternative visual theme that can reduce eye strain, especially in low-light environments. It caters to user preferences, potentially increasing user satisfaction and engagement, and aligns the app with modern design standards.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Dark mode is available and can be toggled on and off from the settings.
* The Intro, Login, Signup, and Complete Profile screens display the dark theme consistently without visual glitches.

Title: Mobile: Implement dark mode for Intro, login, signup, complete profile screens

Description:
Groomed Issue:

**Issue Title:** Implement Dark Mode for Intro, Login, Signup, and Complete Profile Screens

**Description:**  
Enable dark mode across the Intro, Login, Signup, and Complete Profile screens in the mobile application. This includes updating the UI elements, color schemes, and ensuring consistency across all specified screens when dark mode is activated.

**Business Rationale:**  
Introducing dark mode enhances user experience by providing an alternative visual theme that can reduce eye strain, especially in low-light environments. It caters to user preferences, potentially increasing user satisfaction and engagement, and aligns the app with modern design standards.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Dark mode is available and can be toggled on and off from the settings.
* The Intro, Login, Signup, and Complete Profile screens display the dark theme consistently without visual glitches.
* All UI elements, including text, icons, buttons, and backgrounds, adapt appropriately to dark mode.
* Dark mode functionality is tested and verified on all supported mobile devices and screen sizes.
* No loss of functionality or accessibility issues are present when dark mode is enabled.

data.title: Mobile: Setup dark mode framework and config with toggle appearance screen
data.description:
Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Mobile: Setup and Implement Dark Mode

**Description:**
Implement a dark mode toggle within the mobile application, enabling users to switch between Light mode, Dark mode, or adhere to the System default theme.

**Business Rationale:**
Offering a dark mode enhances user experience by providing visual comfort in low-light conditions, catering to user preferences, and improving accessibility. This feature can increase user engagement, satisfaction, and retention by aligning with modern UI trends and user demands.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. **Toggle Availability:** A toggle is accessible in the app settings allowing selection between Light, Dark, and System default themes.
2. **Immediate Application:** Selecting a theme applies the chosen mode instantly across all app screens without requiring a restart.
3. **Design Compliance:** Dark mode adheres to the established design guidelines, ensuring readability and visual consistency.
4. **Persistence:** The selected theme preference is saved and persists across app launches and device reboots.
5. **System Integration:** When set to System default, the app theme automatically adjusts based on the device's current theme setting.

data.title: Maintain Chain Consistency from Ratings Page to Token Details Page
data.description:
#### **Summary**

Currently, when a user filters the **Ratings Page** by a specific chain (e.g., **Base**) and clicks on a token, they are redirected to the **Token Details Page**. However, if the token exists on multiple chains, the **Swap Widget** on the Token Details Page defaults to displaying the token on its most popular chain, which can be confusing.

To improve user experience, we need to **pass the chain name** from the **Ratings Page** to the **Token Details Page** via the backend, ensuring that if a user selects a token on a particular chain, the corresponding Token Details Page reflects the **same chain** in the swap widget.

[Page 1 - Token Chain Display Logic - Token Details Pagee (Swaps) (Figma)](https://www.figma.com/board/T1NZ1zO6Izf095HEChDP1Y/Token-Chain-Display-Logic---Token-Details-Pagee-(Swaps)?node-id=0-1&t=mqjcubC2i9yXobrS-1)

#### **Requirements & Implementation Details**

1. **Single Chain Filter**
   * If the user filters the **Ratings Page** by **one** chain and clicks on a token, the **Token Details Page** must display the token on the same chain in the **Swap Widget**.
   * The **chain name** should be passed from the Ratings Page to the Token Details Page in the request.
2. **Multiple Chains Filter**
   * If the user filters the Ratings Page by **multiple chains**, there is no way to determine the user's intended chain selection.
   * In this case, the **Swap Widget** should default to displaying the token on its **most popular chain**, as determined by the **LiFi provider**.

#### **Expected Behavior**

* The **Token Details Page** should reflect the chain from which the token was selected on the **Ratings Page** (if only one chain was filtered).
* If multiple chains were filtered, the Swap Widget should default to the **most popular chain**.

#### **Impact**

* Ensures consistency between the Ratings Page and the Token Details Page.
* Reduces confusion when swapping tokens across multiple chains.
* Improves user experience by maintaining chain preference where applicable.

data.title: Automation Cypress: Token Swap on Token Details Page
data.description:
**Objective:**

Create an automation test to verify the correctness of the **From** and **To** addresses on the Token Details page.

#### **Scope:**

1. **Verify From and To addresses:**
   * Ensure the correct **chain** information appears in the **From** address.
   * Verify the **token name abbreviation** is displayed in the **To** address.
2. **Test sending process:**
   * Enter a value in the "Send" field.
   * Click the "Connect Wallet" button.
   * Verify that the "Receive" field provides the correct output.
3. **Test wallet connection popup:**
   * Ensure a wallet selection popup appears when clicking the "Connect Wallet" button.

#### **Expected Outcome:**

* The **From** address should display the correct **chain** information.
* The **To** address should show the correct **token name abbreviation**.
* When a value is entered in the "Send" field, the "Receive" field should activate and provide the correct output.
* Clicking the "Connect Wallet" button should trigger a wallet selection popup.

data.title: [Group] - Swap Testing Bugs 2
data.description:
## Title1: Gas Fee Display Mismatch During Swap

**Description:**
When performing a **swap**, the **displayed gas fee** before confirming the transaction does not match the **actual gas fee** deducted after the transaction is processed. This can lead to confusion for users who expect the shown gas fee to be accurate.

[https://jam.dev/c/4b5c8712-f0d4-4a86-8004-85bd53720c34](https://jam.dev/c/4b5c8712-f0d4-4a86-8004-85bd53720c34)

## Title2: Exchange Popup UI/Behavior is Inconsistent Across Different Tokens

**Description:**
The **Exchange Popup** displays inconsistencies depending on the selected token. Some tokens show a different UI layout or missing elements, while others appear as expected. The design and functionality of the popup should be **consistent for all tokens**.

[https://jam.dev/c/b4fdc8b2-4af6-4e78-b9fc-f6343dc114dd](https://jam.dev/c/b4fdc8b2-4af6-4e78-b9fc-f6343dc114dd)

## Title3: 422 Error When Attempting to Perform a Swap

**Description:**
When attempting to perform a **swap**, the system returns a **422 Unprocessable Entity** error, preventing the transaction from being completed. This error suggests that the request is well-formed, but the server is unable to process the request due to issues with the provided data.

[https://jam.dev/c/9b015b2b-1b70-4df5-8a24-fc738bb887f6](https://jam.dev/c/9b015b2b-1b70-4df5-8a24-fc738bb887f6)

## Title4: "Reset Settings" Button Appears Disabled with Faded Color

**Description:**
The **"Reset Settings"** button appears to be disabled, as it is displayed in a faded or light color, which might confuse users. [https://jam.dev/c/30566d5a-f429-4586-aced-33034dff32c7](https://jam.dev/c/30566d5a-f429-4586-aced-33034dff32c7)

Same for Connect Wallet button: [https://jam.dev/c/dae62750-ec30-43b4-bf7e-0293a07a6dd8](https://jam.dev/c/dae62750-ec30-43b4-bf7e-0293a07a6dd8)

## Title5: Wallet Connection Not Persisting When Navigating to Token Details Page

**Description:**
When connecting a wallet on the **Ratings Page**, the connection is successful, but upon navigating to the **Token Details** page, the system asks the user to **connect the wallet again**. This causes an inconsistent user experience, as the wallet connection should persist across pages.

[https://jam.dev/c/c519a849-186c-4997-b7cc-a47ebad634d4](https://jam.dev/c/c519a849-186c-4997-b7cc-a47ebad634d4)

[https://jam.dev/c/d9eed7ef-44ad-4219-9b86-833538c80ace](https://jam.dev/c/d9eed7ef-44ad-4219-9b86-833538c80ace)

parent.title: Testing & QA and Prepare to Production of On-chain swaps (Collaborate with Marketing)

comments.body: Now you can check. it's on staging now.
Yeah. I've used the @ben's design.
@ozcan We are using LiFi widget and there is limited customisability and control over a lot of things.
@bartosz For your item2 comment, you used the design I shared with you right?

#Item-2
I've added unsupported chain alert display for the chain (token) that is not supported by LIFI.

#Item-3

This is the LIFI's issue (or chain issue) which we can't resolve on our side - we should retry the swapping.

#Item-4
This is color setting which we can't control unlike other color can be set.
[https://playground.li.fi/](https://playground.li.fi/)
You can check the demo and setting in this demo lifi widget.

#Item-5
This is because Metamask don't have the auto-connect functionality unlike the other wallet such like Solflare have. Also we've removed the auto connect functionality on the wagmi setting as well since @ian and other users requested to remove it.

#Item-1
The fee difference between **Li.Fi Widget** and **MetaMask** is due to several factors, including how they calculate and display costs. Here’s why:

### 🔹 **1. Different Gas Fee Estimations**

* **Li.Fi Widget** uses **aggregated data from multiple liquidity sources** to estimate gas fees.
* **MetaMask** calculates gas fees **based on Ethereum network conditions** at that moment.
* **Network congestion** can cause discrepancies between the two.

### 🔹 **2. Slippage and Route Differences**

* **Li.Fi Widget** optimizes swaps across multiple DEXs and bridges, each with its own fees.
* **MetaMask** may use a different routing system (e.g., Uniswap, 1inch) with different liquidity pools.
* Slippage settings in **Li.Fi** might differ from what **MetaMask** applies.

### 🔹 **3. Protocol Fees and Spreads**

* **Li.Fi Widget** may add a small fee for its services, depending on the route selected.
* **MetaMask Swaps** charge their own **service fee (0.875%)**, which might not be visible until the final transaction.

### 🔹 **4. Bridge & Network Costs**

* If you are bridging assets, **Li.Fi Widget** includes **bridge fees** that MetaMask doesn’t account for.
* MetaMask usually only considers **network gas fees** for transactions, not bridge service fees.

### 🔹 **5. Real-Time Price Updates**

* **Li.Fi Widget** dynamically updates swap prices based on liquidity, which may **refresh more slowly** than MetaMask.
* If there’s **high volatility**, the estimated swap cost can change quickly.
This issue has been reviewed and updated using AI.

data.title: Error approving TMAI
data.description:
Users are experiencing errors when attempting to approve and stake $TMAI tokens within the V1 DAO Governance and Staking platform. This issue prevents successful staking transactions, as captured in the PostHog recording 

PostHog recording:
saturday

 [https://us.posthog.com/project/132087/replay/01954fa2-2353-7a88-afd4-45055d88be8f?t=419](https://us.posthog.com/project/132087/replay/01954fa2-2353-7a88-afd4-45055d88be8f?t=419)
[https://us.posthog.com/project/132087/replay/01954f9d-5cdf-7e7a-9da3-aec3f4a68cc6?t=233](https://us.posthog.com/project/132087/replay/01954f9d-5cdf-7e7a-9da3-aec3f4a68cc6?t=233)

sunday

[https://us.posthog.com/project/132087/replay/019556bd-6487-7fe7-af66-f4591e3ef1a9](https://us.posthog.com/project/132087/replay/019556bd-6487-7fe7-af66-f4591e3ef1a9)

**Business Rationale:**
Staking $TMAI is a fundamental feature that drives user engagement and participation in DAO governance. Addressing this error is crucial to ensure a seamless user experience, maintain trust in the platform, and support the overall ecosystem's functionality and growth.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. Users can successfully approve $TMAI tokens without encountering errors.
2. Users are able to stake $TMAI tokens seamlessly after approval.
3. The approval and staking processes function correctly across all supported browsers and devices.
4. Comprehensive testing confirms the resolution of the error.
5. Monitoring post-deployment shows no recurrence of the issue.

data.title: Error while Staking in dao
data.description:
Keep trying 1m+ for 12 months and receive error confirming TMAI try again
Wallet connected and displaying balance to stake

Groomed Issue:

**Title:** Resolve TMAI Staking Error in DAO

**Description:**
Users are experiencing errors when attempting to stake TMAI tokens in the DAO. After waiting for over a minute, the staking confirmation fails despite the wallet being connected and displaying sufficient balance, prompting users to attempt the transaction again.

**Business Rationale:**
Ensuring a reliable staking process is crucial for user trust and engagement within the DAO. Fixing this error will enhance the user experience, encourage active participation, and support the overall growth and stability of the DAO ecosystem.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

* Users can successfully stake TMAI tokens in the DAO without encountering errors.
* The staking confirmation process completes within a reasonable time frame without requiring multiple attempts.
* Wallet connection remains stable and accurately displays the staking balance throughout the process.
* Clear and informative error messages are shown if any issues occur, guiding users on the next steps.

data.title: [Group] - All Chain Bugs on Ratings Page 2
data.description:
## Title1: Chain Search Field Clears on Close, But Filters Are Still Applied

**Description:**
When searching for a chain (e.g., "Ethereum") in the **All Chains** dropdown, the list correctly filters to match the search query. However, after closing and reopening the dropdown, the **search field appears empty**, but the previously searched chains are still displayed instead of resetting to show all chains.

[https://jam.dev/c/af136847-f485-4d7c-ad4d-6b3bfb3eccc8](https://jam.dev/c/af136847-f485-4d7c-ad4d-6b3bfb3eccc8)

## Title2 Sorting Refreshes the Page in New UI Instead of Updating Dynamically

**Description:**
In the new UI, sorting actions on the Rating page cause the **entire page to refresh**, whereas in the production environment, sorting updates dynamically without a full page reload. This leads to unnecessary delays and a poor user experience. @ben 

[https://jam.dev/c/7e4d3c52-31a3-41d4-972b-b0f94ab611a3](https://jam.dev/c/7e4d3c52-31a3-41d4-972b-b0f94ab611a3)

## Title3: Display Top and Sort by Trader Grade (Descending) When Applying Chain Filter

**Description:**
When a user applies a **chain filter** on the **Rating Page**, the page should automatically **show top** and the filtered results should be sorted by **Trader Grade in descending order**. 

[https://jam.dev/c/8f86372e-378d-42fb-905e-f994094e375e](https://jam.dev/c/8f86372e-378d-42fb-905e-f994094e375e)

## Title4: Sorting Resets When Navigating to the Second Page on Ratings Page

**Description:**
When sorting the **Ratings Page** and then navigating to the **second page**, the sorting appears to reset. The page displays as if the sorting was never applied

[https://jam.dev/c/69abfa8d-6b6e-4487-bc5e-1edbc361dafe](https://jam.dev/c/69abfa8d-6b6e-4487-bc5e-1edbc361dafe)

data.title: Implement Proper Pagination on the Governance Platform Leaderboard
data.description:
### **Objective:**

Enhance the governance platform leaderboard by implementing a robust pagination system for better user experience and performance on desktop and mobile devices.

[pagination - TMAI_task (Figma)](https://www.figma.com/design/74Zz1grTtdFlkydLSZe3q7/TMAI_task?node-id=9791-38704&t=WT155lXVewXhQiK1-4)

### **Requirements:**

1. **Page Size Selection:**
   * Allow users to select the number of rows displayed per page (e.g., 10, 25, 50, 100).
2. **Pagination Controls:**
   * Implement navigation buttons (Next, Previous, First, Last).
   * Enable direct page selection (e.g., clicking on page numbers).
3. **Current Page Display:**
   * Show the current page and total pages in the format: **"Page X of Y"**.
4. **Performance Optimization:**
   * Ensure efficient data fetching for large datasets (e.g., use backend pagination with API support).
   * Load only the required data per page to improve speed.
5. **Responsive Design:**
   * Ensure pagination works on different screen sizes.
6. **Testing & Validation:**
   * Verify pagination functions correctly with varying data sizes.
   * Check usability across different devices and browsers.

data.title: Automation Cypress: Token Swap on Ratings Page
data.description:
#### **Objective:**

Create an automation test to verify the presence of the **Buy** button on the **Ratings** page and validate the exchange popup functionality.

#### **Scope:**

1. **Verify the Buy button:**
   * Ensure that the **Buy** button is displayed next to the token on the **Ratings** page.
   * Click the **Buy** button to open the exchange popup.
2. **Validate the exchange popup content:**
   * The **From** address should display the correct **chain** information.
   * The **To** address should show the correct **token name abbreviation**.
   * When a value is entered in the **"Send"** field, the **"Receive"** field should activate and provide the correct output.
   * Clicking the **"Connect Wallet"** button should trigger a wallet selection popup.

#### **Expected Outcome:**

* The **Buy** button is present next to the token on the **Ratings** page.
* Clicking the **Buy** button opens the exchange popup.
* The **exchange popup** displays the correct **From** and **To** address details.
* The **Send** and **Receive** fields function correctly.
* The **Connect Wallet** button opens the wallet selection popup.

#### 

---

data.title: K6 Performance Testing for DATA API - First 10 Endpoints
data.description:
**Description:**
Perform performance testing on the following 10 endpoints using K6 and share the results.

#### **Endpoints to Test:**

* **Tokens** (GET)
* **Trader Grades** (GET)
* **Hourly OHLCV** (GET)
* **Investor Grades** (GET)
* **Trader Indices** (GET)
* **Investor Indices** (GET)
* **Market Metrics** (GET)
* **Trading Signals** (GET)
* **AI Reports** (GET)
* **Crypto Investors** (GET)

#### **Scope:**

* Conduct K6 performance tests on the endpoints listed above.
* Measure response times, throughput, and failure rates.
* Identify bottlenecks or performance degradation.
* Share results with the team for further analysis.

#### **Acceptance Criteria:**

* K6 test scripts should be created and executed.
* Performance metrics should be collected and analyzed.
* A summary report should be provided.

parent.title: K6 Performance Testing for DATA API

comments.body: @ian , we have already moved our dev branch to Supabase, but the endpoints are still running on Snowflake. We need to deploy TM 3.0 on Supabase first before pushing the endpoint code to production, as they depend on the users table. We can only deploy once TM 3.0 is finished.
@harshg are these using Snowflake? If so, we need to update to Supabase immediately. These speeds are too slow for production.

@ian @sam @ben @suleman @harshg The same test was run for the relevant endpoints both from the K6 builder interface and using K6 JS on the machine in GitHub. You can find all the details above. If we need to take an action item, we can proceed with a ticket.

### **Performance Analysis Based on the K6 Builder**

#### **Overview of Results**

* **Total Requests Made**: **9.5K**
* **HTTP Failures**: **7.4K** (extremely high failure rate)
* **Peak Requests Per Second (RPS)**: **124.33 reqs/s**
* **95th Percentile Response Time (P95)**: **60,001ms (60s)** (extremely slow, indicating severe performance bottlenecks)

---

#### **Key Observations**

1. **High Failure Rate (7.4K out of 9.5K requests failed)**
   * **Failure rate**: \~**78%**.
   * This suggests **server overload, API crashes, or backend failures**.
   * **Most failures seem to come from the DataApiRamping scenario**, with **6.9K failed requests out of 8.2K** total.
   * **DataApiConstant performed slightly better**, with **417 failed requests out of 1.3K**.
2. **Severe Response Time Issues**
   * **P95 response time**:
     * **DataApiConstant**: **45s**
     * **DataApiRamping**: **1 minute**
   * A **response time of 45-60 seconds i**ndicates backend processing delays, database bottlenecks, or an overwhelmed server.
3. **Low Request Processing Rate**
   * **Average RPS (Requests Per Second)**:
     * **DataApiConstant**: **5.98 req/s**
     * **DataApiRamping**: **37.41 req/s**.

**Detailed Analysis and Summary Report for when we execute test on JS with K6 in cmd**

**Test Scenario**

Load tests `DataApiConstant` and `DataApiRamping` were conducted.

* **Total of 11,261** HTTP requests were sent.
* **Total of 612** iterations were completed.
* Test duration: **3 minutes 30.0 seconds**

**Findings and Issues**

1. **Threshold Breach in HTTP Request Duration**
   * The threshold for `http_req_duration` was exceeded.
   * **Average HTTP response time**: **8.71s** (very high).
   * **90th percentile**: **28.14s**
   * **95th percentile**: **46.51s**
   * **Maximum response time**: **1m0s** (indicates a significant bottleneck.)
2. **High Failure Rate**
   * **68.99% failure rate**: **7,769 out of 11,261 requests failed**.
   * This suggests severe API stability issues under load.
   * Possible causes:
     * **Backend service overload or crash**
     * **Database query failures or excessive locking**
     * **Timeout thresholds exceeded before response**
3. **High Dropped Iteration Count**
   * **Total dropped iterations**: **28,801** (137.12/s)
   * The system was unable to process a substantial portion of expected workloads.
4. **Severe HTTP Request Latency**
   * **Average waiting time**: **8.49s**
   * **Maximum waiting time**: **1m0s**
   * **90th percentile waiting time**: **25.32s**
   * **95th percentile waiting time**: **44.43s**
   * Backend responses are taking excessively long, indicating performance degradation.
5. **HTTP Request Blocking Delays**
   * **Average HTTP request blocked time**: **3.93ms**
   * **Maximum HTTP request blocked time**: **423.35ms**

**Working Aspects**

* **Partial API Availability**: Some requests were processed successfully despite high failure rates.
* **Data Transmission**
  * **Data received**: **1.5 GB (7.3 MB/s)**
  * **Data sent**: **5.8 MB (28 kB/s)**

**Recommendations and Next Steps**

1. **Investigate and Fix API Failures** 
   * The **68.99% failure rate** i
   * Immediate focus should be on:
     * **Reviewing database query execution times and locking issues**
2. **Reduce Dropped Iterations**
   * **28,801 dropped iterations** suggest the system is not scaling effectively under load.
   * Load balancing and API rate limiting should be reassessed.
3. **Re-run Tests After Fixes**
   * Once these issues are addressed, re-run the performance tests to validate improvements.

---

**Conclusion**

The system faced **critical performance degradation**, with **68.99% of requests failing and extreme response times**.

As part of this task, 10 endpoints on the DataAPI were tested. All 10 endpoints are GET requests. ([https://developers.tokenmetrics.com/reference/tokens](https://developers.tokenmetrics.com/reference/tokens))

Constant Arrival Conf: [https://jam.dev/c/7e94a3e1-a96f-4253-9287-f81c6e32b70d](https://jam.dev/c/7e94a3e1-a96f-4253-9287-f81c6e32b70d)

RampingVUs Conf: [https://jam.dev/c/dfa60aa4-231e-4dda-8b05-52610a48f59a](https://jam.dev/c/dfa60aa4-231e-4dda-8b05-52610a48f59a)

issues.full_context:
Title: K6 Performance Testing for DATA API - First 10 Endpoints

Description:
**Description:**
Perform performance testing on the following 10 endpoints using K6 and share the results.

#### **Endpoints to Test:**

* **Tokens** (GET)
* **Trader Grades** (GET)
* **Hourly OHLCV** (GET)
* **Investor Grades** (GET)
* **Trader Indices** (GET)
* **Investor Indices** (GET)
* **Market Metrics** (GET)
* **Trading Signals** (GET)
* **AI Reports** (GET)
* **Crypto Investors** (GET)

#### **Scope:**

* Conduct K6 performance tests on the endpoints listed above.
* Measure response times, throughput, and failure rates.
* Identify bottlenecks or performance degradation.
* Share results with the team for further analysis.

#### **Acceptance Criteria:**

* K6 test scripts should be created and executed.
* Performance metrics should be collected and analyzed.
* A summary report should be provided.

* Validate the availability and response of the Token API endpoints.

#### **Acceptance Criteria:**

* Postman tests should be created to check the API endpoints.
* The tests should run periodically to detect failures.
* If an endpoint fails, an alert or log should be generated.

data.title: Implement Swap Functionality on Indices Treemap Chart
data.description:
**Description:** Add a swap feature that enables users to trade tokens directly from the treemap view on the Indicespage. This functionality should provide a seamless flow for initiating and completing swaps without leaving the treemap interface.

**Business Rationale:**
Enhancing the treemap chart with swap capabilities will improve user experience by simplifying the trading process. This streamlined approach can increase user engagement and trading activity by making it easier and more efficient for users to exchange tokens within the platform.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

1. A "Buy token" option is available for each token displayed in the treemap chart on the token details page on hover.
2. Selecting "Buy token" opens a swap widget where users can choose the target token and specify the amount to trade.
3. The swap process integrates with the existing trading backend and completes transactions accurately.
4. Users receive a confirmation message upon successful completion of a swap.
5. The swap feature aligns with the design specifications outlined in the [Figma task](https://www.figma.com/design/74Zz1grTtdFlkydLSZe3q7/TMAI_task?node-id=7925-64586&t=XnB1WXk45XYAX0Vm-4).
6. The feature is fully tested and functions correctly across all supported browsers and devices.
